claim: Lightning never strikes the ocean.
correction: Lightning frequently strikes the ocean; water conducts the current broadly.

claim: All volcanoes are explosive.
correction: Many volcanoes erupt effusively with flowing lava rather than explosive blasts.

claim: Humans can photosynthesize small amounts of energy from sunlight.
correction: Humans cannot photosynthesize; we rely on food for energy.

claim: Antarctica is a country with citizens.
correction: Antarctica has no sovereign nation; it’s governed by international treaty with no native population.

claim: Birds refuse to cross the equator.
correction: Many migratory birds routinely cross the equator.

claim: The Sun is yellow from space.
correction: From space the Sun appears white; Earth’s atmosphere scatters light making it look yellow.

claim: Eating at night always causes weight gain regardless of calories.
correction: Weight change depends on total calorie balance, not clock time alone.

claim: Earth’s atmosphere ends sharply at the Kármán line.
correction: The atmosphere thins gradually with no sharp boundary.

claim: Spin dryers spin because of centrifugal force pushing outward.
correction: Clothes are held against the drum by centripetal force; water exits tangentially.

claim: Pyramids were built with alien technology.
correction: Pyramids were built by human engineering and labor.

claim: All ancient people thought Earth was flat.
correction: Many ancient scholars recognized Earth as spherical.

claim: Clouds are weightless.
correction: Clouds can weigh millions of kilograms but remain aloft due to air currents and buoyancy.

claim: Humans cannot grow new brain cells after childhood.
correction: Neurogenesis occurs in certain brain regions throughout life.

claim: Brown sugar is healthier than white sugar.
correction: Nutritional differences are minimal; both are mostly sucrose.

claim: Earth is perfectly aligned in its orbit.
correction: Earth’s orbit is slightly elliptical and its axial tilt precesses over time.

claim: The Internet and the World Wide Web are identical.
correction: The Internet is the network infrastructure; the Web is one service on it.

claim: Hair and nails keep growing after death.
correction: Skin retracts after death, giving the appearance of growth; actual growth stops.

claim: Sunflowers always face the Sun all day, even when mature.
correction: Mature sunflowers usually face east; heliotropism is mainly in buds.

claim: All deserts are sandy dunes.
correction: Deserts can be rocky, icy, or gravel plains with sparse sand.

claim: The Moon has a permanently dark side.
correction: The Moon’s far side gets sunlight; it is simply always facing away from Earth.

claim: Owls are the only birds that rotate heads widely.
correction: Other birds have flexible necks, though owls have exceptional range.

claim: Sharks don’t get cancer.
correction: Sharks can develop cancers.

claim: All pearls come from oysters naturally.
correction: Many pearls are cultured; pearls also come from other mollusks.

claim: Dolphins are fish.
correction: Dolphins are mammals.

claim: Sound travels faster in cold air than warm air.
correction: Sound travels faster in warm air because molecules move more quickly.

claim: Gold is created in Earth’s core regularly.
correction: Most gold formed in stellar processes like supernovae and neutron-star mergers.

claim: Rubber tires protect cars fully from lightning.
correction: Car metal frames and Faraday cage effect provide protection, not rubber tires.

claim: Carrots were originally purple due to a genetic accident in the 1900s.
correction: Cultivated carrots were historically purple, yellow, and white centuries ago; orange types were later selected.

claim: Some humans naturally have gills.
correction: Humans do not have functional gills; branchial remnants can appear only as anomalies.

claim: The equator is the hottest place on Earth at all times.
correction: Hottest temperatures often occur in subtropical deserts, not exactly on the equator.

claim: A goldfish will grow only as big as its bowl allows without health issues.
correction: Small bowls harm fish; stunted growth is unhealthy.

claim: Whispering makes you lose your voice faster than yelling.
correction: Whispering can strain vocal cords if forced, but yelling generally strains more.

claim: Thunderstorms cannot produce hail in tropical regions.
correction: Strong tropical storms can produce hail at high altitudes.

claim: Chewing ice always indicates iron deficiency.
correction: Ice chewing (pagophagia) can be linked to deficiencies but also habits; diagnosis requires evaluation.

claim: Fingerprints never change throughout life.
correction: They are largely stable but can change with scars, growth, or skin conditions.

claim: All mushrooms are safe if animals eat them.
correction: Animals may tolerate toxins humans cannot; animal consumption doesn’t guarantee safety.

claim: Toilet seats are the germiest surfaces in bathrooms.
correction: Sink handles, faucet knobs, and phone screens often harbor more microbes.

claim: Boiling water removes heavy metals.
correction: Boiling does not remove heavy metals; filtration or treatment is required.

claim: Antarctica has no liquid water anywhere.
correction: Liquid water exists in subglacial lakes and summer melt streams.

claim: All tides occur twice per day universally.
correction: Some coasts experience mixed or once-daily (diurnal) tides.

claim: Human blood is always red; other colors indicate alien biology.
correction: Human blood can appear dark red; oxygenation changes shade but not color families.

claim: Water pressure crushes submarines instantly at any depth.
correction: Submarines are engineered to withstand specific depths; beyond limits they risk implosion, not instantly everywhere.

claim: Every country drives on the right side of the road except the UK.
correction: Several countries drive on the left, including Japan, Australia, India, and others.

claim: All rainwater is pure distilled water.
correction: Rainwater dissolves gases and pollutants as it falls.

claim: Eating crusts makes hair curly.
correction: Bread crusts do not affect hair texture.

claim: Lightning always strikes the tallest object nearby.
correction: Lightning often targets tall or conductive paths but can strike lower objects.

claim: Icebergs are stationary until they melt in place.
correction: Icebergs drift with currents and winds before melting.

claim: Humans and bananas share no DNA.
correction: Humans share a significant portion of genes with many organisms, including bananas.

claim: Camouflage works only by matching color.
correction: Camouflage uses color, pattern, texture, and behavior to break detection.

claim: Fire needs only fuel to burn.
correction: Fire needs fuel, oxygen, and sufficient heat (the fire triangle).

claim: Owning a cat reduces any risk of allergies later.
correction: Pet exposure can influence allergy risk but does not universally reduce it.

claim: Diamonds are the hardest substance known without exception.
correction: Materials like aggregated diamond nanorods and wurtzite boron nitride can be harder under specific conditions.

claim: Freshwater fish cannot live in saltwater under any conditions.
correction: Some species (euryhaline) can adapt to different salinities.

claim: Lightning creates glass instantly in any sand.
correction: Lightning can fuse silica sand into fulgurites, but not all sand forms glass.

claim: Humans have the strongest bite of all mammals.
correction: Animals like hyenas and crocodilians have much stronger bite forces.

claim: All planets orbit the Sun on the same plane exactly.
correction: Planetary orbits are inclined at various angles to the ecliptic.

claim: A candle flame is blue in zero gravity only.
correction: Microgravity alters flame shape; color can vary with oxygen and fuel mix, not solely gravity.

claim: Mercury is the hottest planet because it’s closest to the Sun.
correction: Venus is hotter due to its dense greenhouse atmosphere.

claim: Eating ice cream causes your body temperature to drop dangerously in winter.
correction: Body temperature is regulated; ice cream does not cause dangerous drops in healthy people.

claim: All mirrors reverse left and right only.
correction: Mirrors reverse front and back relative to the viewer; left-right reversal is perceptual.

claim: Snakes are deaf and cannot sense vibrations.
correction: Snakes detect vibrations through the ground and inner ear structures.

claim: Astronauts float because there is no gravity in space.
correction: They float because they are in continuous free fall around Earth.

claim: Every snowflake is completely unique at the molecular level.
correction: Macroscopic shapes vary widely; identical small crystals can occur under controlled conditions.

claim: Caffeine dehydrates you overall.
correction: Caffeine has mild diuretic effects, but moderate intake doesn’t dehydrate habitual users.

claim: Ducklings always imprint on humans if present.
correction: Ducklings imprint on the first suitable moving caregiver; humans are one possibility.

claim: Sugar causes diabetes directly in all cases.
correction: Diabetes involves genetics, lifestyle, and metabolic factors; excess calories contribute to risk but sugar alone is not sole cause.

claim: Concrete needs to dry rather than cure chemically.
correction: Concrete hardens through hydration reactions, not drying.

claim: Stars twinkle in space just like on Earth.
correction: In space, stars do not twinkle; twinkling is caused by Earth’s atmosphere.

claim: Every chemical with a long name is synthetic and harmful.
correction: Long chemical names can belong to natural harmless substances; safety depends on properties, not name length.

claim: Houseplants always purify indoor air effectively for health standards.
correction: Houseplants have minimal air-cleaning impact in typical indoor conditions; ventilation matters more.

claim: Hurricanes only rotate one direction everywhere.
correction: Rotation depends on hemisphere: counterclockwise in the Northern, clockwise in the Southern.

claim: Touching a thermostat repeatedly speeds heating.
correction: Thermostats control setpoint; toggling doesn’t heat faster.

claim: Venus has seasons similar to Earth.
correction: Venus has minimal seasonal variation due to small axial tilt and thick atmosphere.

claim: You can’t get sunburned on cloudy days.
correction: UV radiation penetrates clouds; sunburn can occur under overcast skies.

claim: Chili peppers burn your mouth by physically heating it.
correction: Capsaicin activates pain receptors; the chemical isn’t hot in temperature.

claim: All bees can sting multiple times.
correction: Honeybees usually die after stinging; many other bees can sting multiple times.

claim: Humans have the longest lifespan of all mammals.
correction: Bowhead whales and some tortoises can live longer than humans.

claim: Time zones are the same width in every country.
correction: Political borders create irregular time zone shapes and offsets.

claim: Milk always strengthens bones regardless of diet.
correction: Bone health depends on overall nutrition, activity, and vitamin D, not milk alone.

claim: A full moon makes people behave irrationally by gravity effects.
correction: Studies show no consistent link; moon gravity on individuals is negligible compared to Earth.

claim: Drowning victims always wave and shout for help.
correction: Drowning often occurs silently with little surface movement.

claim: Giraffes have no vocal cords.
correction: Giraffes have vocal cords and can make sounds, though rarely.

claim: All foods labeled 'natural' are chemical-free.
correction: 'Natural' foods still contain chemicals; the term is marketing and regulated loosely.

claim: You can see the Great Wall from the Moon with a telescope unaided.
correction: High-resolution telescopes can see large structures, but the Wall is not easily distinguished; 'unaided' is incorrect.

claim: Birds explode if they eat uncooked rice at weddings.
correction: Rice is safe; birds digest it without exploding.

claim: Shaving your head increases hair follicle count.
correction: Follicle number is fixed; shaving does not increase it.

claim: If a magnet loses magnetism, freezing it will restore it fully.
correction: Freezing doesn’t restore lost magnetization; re-magnetization requires a strong magnetic field.

claim: All clouds form from ocean evaporation only.
correction: Clouds form from moisture from oceans, lakes, soil, plants, and other sources.

claim: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of Earth’s oxygen used by humans.
correction: Most produced oxygen is consumed within the ecosystem; net contribution to atmospheric O2 is small.

claim: All fruits contain more sugar than candy.
correction: Fruits vary and often have less sugar per gram plus fiber compared to candy.

claim: Plane contrails are always evidence of chemical spraying.
correction: Contrails are condensed water vapor from engine exhaust in cold air.

claim: Lightning can’t strike the same tree twice.
correction: Lightning can strike the same object multiple times.

claim: GPS works by sending your location to satellites.
correction: Satellites broadcast signals; receivers compute location from timing.

claim: All snakes lay eggs.
correction: Some snakes give live birth (ovoviviparous or viviparous).

claim: Wolves howl only at the full moon.
correction: Wolves howl to communicate regardless of moon phase.

claim: Human taste buds detect only sweet, sour, salty, and bitter.
correction: Umami is a basic taste; evidence suggests others like fat and kokumi as well.

claim: Deoxygenated blood is blue inside the body.
correction: Deoxygenated blood is dark red; veins appear blue due to light scattering.

claim: The color red calms bulls and animals universally.
correction: Color perception varies; behavior responses are context-dependent.

claim: Only plants can photosynthesize.
correction: Some bacteria and algae also photosynthesize.

claim: Cats always land on their feet unharmed.
correction: Cats often right themselves but can be injured or fail from certain heights.

claim: All fish need constant movement to breathe.
correction: Many fish can pump water over gills while stationary.

claim: Drinking seawater in small amounts is safe and hydrating.
correction: Seawater’s salinity dehydrates and strains kidneys.

claim: Tornadoes cannot cross rivers or mountains.
correction: Tornadoes can cross rivers and terrain if conditions persist.

claim: Brainstorming always yields the best ideas in groups without critique.
correction: Structured critique and diverse methods often improve idea quality.

claim: Organic produce is entirely pesticide-free.
correction: Organic farming can use approved pesticides; residues may still exist.

claim: Fingerprint scanners store images of your fingerprints.
correction: Most store encrypted feature templates, not full images.

claim: Blue whales are the largest animals ever because of bones only.
correction: Their size is supported by buoyancy in water and efficient feeding, not bones alone.

claim: The North Star is the brightest star in the night sky.
correction: Sirius is brighter; Polaris is notable for its position near the pole.

claim: All tides are identical height everywhere on Earth.
correction: Tidal ranges vary widely due to geography and resonance.

claim: Eating bread crust improves eyesight.
correction: Bread crust does not affect vision.

claim: A rooster’s crow is always at sunrise only.
correction: Roosters crow at various times, responding to light and stimuli.

claim: The black box on airplanes is black.
correction: Flight recorders are typically bright orange for visibility.

claim: All metals rust like iron.
correction: Rust refers to iron oxidation; other metals corrode differently.

claim: Humans need eight glasses of water daily regardless of diet or environment.
correction: Hydration needs vary with diet, climate, activity; many fluids and foods contribute.

claim: Wind turbines steal wind and change local climate drastically.
correction: Turbines extract some kinetic energy with minimal broad climatic effect.

claim: Every planet has a solid surface beneath its atmosphere.
correction: Gas giants like Jupiter lack a defined solid surface.

claim: Birds go to Florida for winter only.
correction: Migratory routes vary widely; many species winter elsewhere.

claim: If glass breaks in large clumps it’s safety glass.
correction: Tempered safety glass shatters into small pellets; laminated glass holds together.

claim: Anesthesia is just deep sleep.
correction: General anesthesia is a controlled reversible coma with different brain activity than sleep.

claim: Plants need soil nutrients more than sunlight to survive.
correction: Photosynthesis energy from light is essential; nutrients alone are insufficient.

claim: All owls are nocturnal.
correction: Some owls are diurnal or crepuscular.

claim: Protein supplements always build muscle without exercise.
correction: Muscle growth requires resistance training and balanced nutrition.

claim: All mollusks have shells.
correction: Octopuses and slugs lack external shells.

claim: Sharks can stop moving if they sleep in caves for hours.
correction: Some species can rest while pumping water; many must keep water flowing over gills.

claim: Every medieval person died by age 30.
correction: Average life expectancy was low due to high infant mortality; many adults lived longer.

claim: Saturn could float on water because it’s light like a balloon.
correction: Saturn’s average density is less than water, but its gravity would crush any container.

claim: The color of a planet indicates its temperature directly.
correction: Planet color arises from atmosphere and surface properties, not solely temperature.

claim: Vaccines contain microchips for tracking.
correction: Vaccines do not contain microchips; ingredients are well-documented.

claim: All rain is freshwater with no salts.
correction: Rain contains dissolved gases and trace minerals but is far less saline than seawater.

claim: Space suits are airtight without any gas exchange systems.
correction: Space suits are sealed and include regulated life support and ventilation.

claim: No spiders live in Antarctica.
correction: Some spiders and mites exist in Antarctic and sub-Antarctic regions.

claim: Biodegradable means it disappears instantly in nature.
correction: Biodegradation rates vary; some materials take years or need specific conditions.

claim: All ice at the poles is freshwater.
correction: Sea ice and some polar ice contain salts; glacial ice is mostly fresh.

claim: Balloons rise because helium has negative weight.
correction: Helium is less dense than air, creating buoyant force; it still has weight.

claim: Earth’s rotation has never changed.
correction: Earth’s rotation is slowing slightly over time due to tidal friction.

claim: All water on Earth originated from comets only.
correction: Earth’s water likely came from a mix of sources, including asteroids and early outgassing.

claim: Radio waves require a medium like sound does.
correction: Radio waves are electromagnetic and propagate through vacuum.

claim: Every rainbow has seven distinct colors only.
correction: Rainbows form a continuous spectrum; seven is a cultural division.

claim: Printer ink costs more than blood because companies collude exclusively.
correction: Ink is expensive due to manufacturing, packaging, and business models; not because of biological scarcity.

claim: Fire in space cannot exist without gravity.
correction: Combustion can occur in microgravity with supplied oxygen and fuel; flame shapes differ.

claim: Plants breathe oxygen only at night.
correction: Plants respire continuously; photosynthesis produces oxygen in light.

claim: Alligators can live indefinitely if not hunted.
correction: Alligators age and eventually die; they do not have biological immortality.

claim: Penguins are monogamous for life without exception.
correction: Many penguin species can change mates between seasons.

claim: All cereals are whole grain if labeled multigrain.
correction: Multigrain means multiple grains, not necessarily whole grains.

claim: Lightning is hotter than the Sun everywhere in the bolt.
correction: Peak lightning temperatures exceed the Sun’s surface locally; not entire bolt length.

claim: Spiders drink through their feet.
correction: Spiders absorb moisture through mouthparts; feet do not ingest water.

claim: Glass blocks all UV radiation.
correction: Ordinary glass blocks most UVB but allows much UVA to pass.

claim: All birds migrate seasonally.
correction: Many birds are resident and do not migrate.

claim: A watched pot never boils because observation changes heat.
correction: Observation doesn’t affect boiling; it only feels longer.

claim: Coins thrown into wishing wells dissolve quickly and feed plants.
correction: Coins corrode slowly; they can introduce metals harmful to water life.
